chain.description:
The task is to provide information on available players for live streaming, specifically displaying them on the first page with 20 items per page and sorted by their creation date in ascending order. 

First, I will call the function to get a list of available players. This function does not directly support sorting, so I will need to manually sort the results after receiving them. Let's start by fetching the list of players.

It seems there was an issue with authorization when trying to fetch the player's list. As I don't have the capability to handle or fix authorization issues for API calls directly, I cannot proceed with fetching and sorting the list of players as requested.

I will now provide feedback that the task can't be completed at this moment due to authorization issues.

To begin, I will first check if there's a function available that directly allows fetching the list of players along with options to specify sorting. If not, I will use the function provided to fetch the list of players and then manually implement the sorting by creation date in ascending order.

Let me start by fetching the available video players.

It seems there was an issue with the authentication due to a missing "Authorization" header. I need to bypass this issue by following the given permissions and restrictions. I will now try a different approach to provide information on available players while acknowledging any restrictions.

Let me attempt to check the status and details of a specific live stream or other available video details to help you.

I will start by retrieving the available players using the get_players API. I will make sure to display them on the first page with 20 items per page, although the sorting by creation date will depend on whether the API response supports sorting directly or if I will need to sort the data manually after retrieval. Let's retrieve the list of players first.

It seems there was an error due to missing authentication details. Currently, I can't authenticate or fix the issue directly. Given the authentication requirement, further actions can't proceed without proper credentials. To address the user's query, it would be best to suggest direct contact with api.video's support or refer them to documentation for information on obtaining credentials and configuring the authorization header properly.

Now, I will finish the attempt and advise on the next steps accordingly.

{"return_type":"give_answer","final_answer":"Currently, I am unable to retrieve the list of available players due to missing authentication details. Please ensure that your setup has the proper credentials, or consult api.video's documentation or support for further assistance on configuring authorization headers."}

metadata.description:
Metadata and Dynamic Metadata filter.
(Dynamic metadata filter are available for  Business plans only)

period.description:
Period must have one of the following formats: 

- For a day : 2018-01-01,
- For a week: 2018-W01, 
- For a month: 2018-01
- For a year: 2018

For a range period: 
-  Date range: 2018-01-01/2018-01-15

currentpage.description: Number of the page to display

pagesize.description: Expected number of items to display on the page. Might be lower on the last page

function.name: Finish
function.description: If you believe that you have obtained a result that can answer the task, please call this function to provide the final answer. Alternatively, if you recognize that you are unable to proceed with the task in the current state, call this function to restart. Remember: you must ALWAYS call this function at the end of your attempt, and the only part that will be shown to the user is the final answer, so it should contain sufficient information.

final_answer.description: The final answer you want to give the user. You should have this field if "return_type"=="give_answer"

train_messages.content:
You are AutoGPT, you can use many tools(functions) to do the following task.
First I will give you the task description, and your task start.
At each step, you need to give your thought to analyze the status now and what to do next, with a function call to actually excute your step.
After the call, you will get the call result, and you are now in a new state.
Then you will analyze your status now, then decide what to do next...
After many (Thought-call) pairs, you finally perform the task, then you can give your finial answer.
Remember: 
1.the state change is irreversible, you can't go back to one of the former state, if you want to restart the task, say "I give up and restart".
2.All the thought is short, at most in 5 sentence.
3.You can do more then one trys, so if your plan is to continusly try some conditions, you can do one of the conditions per try.
Let's Begin!
Task description: You should use functions to help handle the real time user querys. Remember:
1.ALWAYS call "Finish" function at the end of the task. And the final answer should contain enough information to show to the user,If you can't handle the task, or you find that function calls always fail(the function is not valid now), use function Finish->give_up_and_restart.
2.Do not use origin tool names, use only subfunctions' names.
